metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（大沙龙站涡动相关仪-2021）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Dashalong station eddy covariance system (EC) in the upstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2021. The site (98.9406° E, 38.8399° N) was located in the Qilian County in Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3739 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.5 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500RS) was 0.15 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. Due to the power loss and the problems of datalogger, data were missing occasionally in the winter. 
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2021年1月1日至2021年12月31日的黑河流域地表过程综合观测网上游大沙龙站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县，下垫面是沼泽化高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是98.9406E, 38.8399N，海拔3739 m。涡动相关仪的架高4.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3）与CO2/H2O分析仪（Li7500RS）之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。冬季由于供电不足和采集器的问题，数据间断出现错误， 
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
research objective: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China.
This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.
challenges: However, several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. However, the above modeling efforts suffered from 1) the availability of the forcing data (only two weather stations operated by the Chinese Meteorological Administration functioned in the upper reaches of the HRB) and 2) a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization.
Unfortunately, this did not work well due to the influence of strong wind. Therefore, snow density data, which can be calculated using snow depth and SWE data, are not available at present.
methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.
dataset: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文学研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文学研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱黑河流域生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区内雪盖分布广泛，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪盖的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析较为复杂，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有益的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的发展。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS，以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）处每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（例如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟，以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the core components of a comprehensive observation network for alpine hydrology in the upper reaches of river basins?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn:
高山水文学综合观测网络的核心组成部分包括：

1. **气象观测站**：用于监测降水、温度、湿度、风速和辐射等气象要素。
2. **水文观测站**：用于测量河流流量、水位和水温等水文数据。
3. **土壤湿度传感器**：用于监测土壤水分状况，评估水分入渗和蒸发情况。
4. **雪深和雪水当量监测**：用于评估积雪的深度和融雪水量。
5. **水质监测设备**：用于检测水体中的化学成分和污染物。
6. **遥感技术**：用于获取大范围的地表变化和水文特征信息。
7. **数据管理和分析系统**：用于存储、处理和分析观测数据，支持决策制定。
8. **生态监测**：评估水文变化对生态系统的影响，包括植物和动物的生境变化。
9. **模型和预测工具**：用于模拟水文过程和预测未来的水文变化。
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Automatic meteorological stations, snow observation superstation, frozen ground observation superstation
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 自动气象站、积雪观测超级站、冻土观测超级站

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to monitor snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于监测高山地区雪积累和融化过程的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: Snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments, including the measurement of snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE), and blowing (drifting) snow using tools like SR50A for snow depth and GMON for SWE.
Example.AnswerCn: 雪观测超级站使用先进的技术和仪器收集了雪盖特性，包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）的测量，使用的工具包括SR50A用于雪深测量和GMON用于雪水当量测量。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting high-quality observation data in alpine hydrology, and how has it been addressed in recent studies?
Example.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学中收集高质量观测数据面临的一个挑战是什么，以及最近的研究是如何解决这个问题的？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in alpine hydrology is the scarcity of observation data due to harsh climates and complex topography. This has been addressed by establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network comprising automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations to ensure consistent data collection across different scales.
Example.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯水文学面临的一个挑战是由于恶劣气候和复杂地形导致观测数据稀缺。为了解决这个问题，建立了一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站，以确保在不同尺度上进行一致的数据收集。

Example.QuestionEn: Provide an example of how an integrated observation network can contribute to the validation and improvement of remote sensing products in alpine regions.
Example.QuestionCn: 提供一个集成观测网络如何有助于验证和改善高山地区遥感产品的示例。
Example.AnswerEn: An integrated observation network, composed of meteorological stations and superstations, provides fine-resolution data that can be used to validate remote sensing products. For example, snow and frozen ground observations at superstations enable the validation of remote sensing data, which is crucial for improving the accuracy of hydrological models in alpine regions.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个综合观测网络，由气象站和超级站组成，提供高分辨率的数据，可用于验证遥感产品。例如，超级站的雪和冻土观测能够验证遥感数据，这对于提高高山地区水文模型的准确性至关重要。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the data processing steps used in the eddy covariance technique within alpine hydrological studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在高山水文研究中，涡度协方差技术所使用的数据处理步骤的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: wild point value exclusion, delay time correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, density correction, quality evaluation based on atmospheric stationarity and turbulence similarity characteristics
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 野点值剔除、延迟时间校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、超声虚温校正、密度校正、基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征的质量评估。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with data collection in alpine hydrology research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges in alpine hydrology data collection include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which can inhibit complete and consistent data collection. Scarcity of observations due to access difficulties and technological barriers also complicates the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Definition.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯水文数据收集面临的挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形，这些因素可能会妨碍完整和一致的数据收集。由于访问困难和技术障碍，观测稀缺也使得遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展变得复杂。

Definition.QuestionEn: What constitutes high-quality hydrometeorological data in alpine research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯研究中，什么构成高质量的水文气象数据？
Definition.AnswerEn: High-quality hydrometeorological data in alpine research encompasses gap-free meteorological and hydrological observations, specifically focusing on snow cover and frozen ground properties. These datasets are intended to provide accurate forcing data for models, validate remote sensing data, and enhance understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 高质量的水文气象数据在阿尔卑斯研究中包括无缺口的气象和水文观测，特别关注雪盖和冻土特性。这些数据集旨在为模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并增强对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can researchers interpret the impact of snow cover and frozen ground data on hydrological processes in the upper reaches of river basins, and what methodologies are essential for accurate data collection in these environments?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何解读雪盖和冻土数据对河流流域上游水文过程的影响，以及在这些环境中进行准确数据收集所需的关键方法论。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Researchers can interpret the impact of snow cover and frozen ground data on hydrological processes by analyzing data from integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks. Key methodologies for accurate data collection include using snow observation superstations equipped with state-of-the-art instruments to measure snow depth, snow water equivalent, and blowing snow fluxes. These measurements, combined with soil temperature and moisture profiles, help in understanding the freeze-thaw cycles and their influence on water dynamics. The use of remote sensing products and their validation with fine-resolution data from superstations is also essential to improve the predictive understanding of these processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 研究人员可以通过分析来自综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络的雪盖和冻土数据，来解释其对水文过程的影响。准确数据收集的关键方法包括使用配备先进仪器的雪观测超级站，测量雪深、雪水当量和吹雪通量。这些测量结果结合土壤温度和湿度剖面，有助于理解冻融循环及其对水动态的影响。使用遥感产品并与超级站的高分辨率数据进行验证，对于提高对这些过程的预测理解也至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can an observation network be optimized to address the scarcity of data in alpine regions, and what strategies might be most effective in ensuring continuous data collection despite environmental challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何优化观测网络以应对阿尔卑斯地区数据稀缺的问题，并且在确保持续数据收集方面，哪些策略可能在应对环境挑战时最为有效？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: An observation network can be optimized by establishing a combination of automatic meteorological stations and superstations that provide multiscale observations. Strategies to ensure continuous data collection include deploying wireless sensor networks to capture seasonal changes in soil and atmospheric conditions, and using robust sensors capable of withstanding extreme weather. Additionally, the integration of remote sensing data with on-ground observations can fill data gaps and provide comprehensive datasets. Ensuring reliable power sources and data storage solutions at high altitudes is crucial to minimize data loss due to power outages or sensor malfunctions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察网络可以通过建立自动气象站和超级站的组合来优化，以提供多尺度观测。确保持续数据收集的策略包括部署无线传感器网络，以捕捉土壤和大气条件的季节变化，以及使用能够承受极端天气的稳健传感器。此外，将遥感数据与地面观测相结合可以填补数据空白，提供全面的数据集。在高海拔地区确保可靠的电源和数据存储解决方案至关重要，以最小化因停电或传感器故障导致的数据丢失。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in collecting comprehensive observation data in alpine regions for hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集全面观测数据以进行水文模型分析的挑战原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方/时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, and what motivates the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区观察数据稀缺，以及推动下一代生态系统观察网络发展的动机是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, which has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the complexity and uncertainty of remote sensing data for hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响高山地区水文过程遥感数据复杂性和不确定性的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Due to the complexities of the earth system, various sources of uncertainties exist in remote sensing data, especially in the alpine region, which need to be validated and calibrated to improve the prediction of hydrological processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据中存在各种不确定性，特别是在高山地区，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准，以改善水文过程的预测。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the likely consequences on data quality when integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations in alpine hydrology research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，将遥感数据与地面观测数据整合时，数据质量可能会受到哪些影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations can improve the prediction of hydrological processes, but it introduces uncertainties due to the complexities of the earth system, especially in the alpine region. These uncertainties need to be validated and calibrated to ensure data quality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合可以提高水文过程的预测能力，但由于地球系统的复杂性，尤其是在高山地区，这引入了不确定性。这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准，以确保数据质量。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects on dataset availability and quality when facing challenges such as harsh climate and high altitudes in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在高山地区面临严酷气候和高海拔等挑战时，数据集的可用性和质量可能会受到以下潜在影响：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Challenges like harsh climate and high altitudes can lead to incomplete and inconsistent data collection, hindering the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. This scarcity of observation data can impede research but also motivates the development of advanced ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 恶劣的气候和高海拔等挑战可能导致数据收集不完整和不一致，从而阻碍遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。这种观测数据的稀缺可能会妨碍研究，但也激励了先进生态系统观测网络和实验的开发。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives are aimed to be achieved by utilizing high-quality hydrometeorological data in alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 利用高质量水文气象数据在高山水文学研究中旨在实现的目标有哪些？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, integrate observation, simulation, and datasets for informative understanding, and understand how climate change and human activities alter fundamental processes. These objectives support the development of remote sensing products and the validation of hydrological models.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是为阿尔卑斯水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，整合观测、模拟和数据集以获得有益的理解，并了解气候变化和人类活动如何改变基本过程。这些目标支持遥感产品的开发和水文模型的验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific procedures for setting up a multiscale observation network to capture alpine hydrological processes effectively?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 建立多尺度观测网络以有效捕捉高山水文过程的具体程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To set up a multiscale observation network for alpine hydrological processes, an integrated system with automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations is established. This network includes seven AMSs and two superstations designed for snow cover and frozen ground observations. The network captures data at both basin and sub-basin scales, focusing on meteorological driving forces, snow accumulation and ablation processes, and freeze-thaw cycles. The procedures involve continuous monitoring of variables such as wind, air temperature, humidity, and precipitation, as well as specific measurements like snow depth and soil moisture profiles.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了建立一个多尺度的高山水文过程观测网络，建立了一个集成系统，包括自动气象站（AMSs）和超级站。该网络包括七个自动气象站和两个超级站，旨在进行雪盖和冻土观测。该网络在流域和子流域尺度上捕获数据，重点关注气象驱动因素、雪的积累和融化过程以及冻融循环。该程序涉及对风、气温、湿度和降水等变量的持续监测，以及雪深和土壤湿度剖面等特定测量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced in collecting consistent and comprehensive datasets in alpine regions, and how can these be overcome?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集一致和全面的数据集面临哪些挑战，以及如何克服这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting datasets in alpine regions include harsh climate conditions, high altitude, and complex topography, which can lead to incomplete and inconsistent data. Overcoming these challenges involves developing an integrated and distributed observation network with advanced technologies like automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. Additionally, utilizing remote sensing data and data assimilation techniques helps improve prediction accuracy and compensates for data gaps due to environmental and technical barriers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集数据集的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形，这可能导致数据不完整和不一致。克服这些挑战需要建立一个集成和分布式的观测网络，采用先进技术，如自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站。此外，利用遥感数据和数据同化技术有助于提高预测准确性，并弥补由于环境和技术障碍造成的数据缺口。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological innovations have facilitated the continuous monitoring of hydrometeorological data in alpine regions despite harsh climate conditions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术创新促进了在恶劣气候条件下对高山地区水文气象数据的持续监测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). High-resolution soil physics datasets were obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The use of advanced instruments like GMON and FlowCapt also facilitated detailed snow and soil observations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。为了捕捉冻土过程，获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，这些数据来自一个冻土观测超级站。使用GMON和FlowCapt等先进仪器也促进了对雪和土壤的详细观测。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do integrated observation networks enable the comprehensive study of coupled hydrological and ecological processes in alpine river basins?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 综合观测网络如何促进对高山流域中耦合水文和生态过程的全面研究？
Enablement.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network with automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations allows for the collection of comprehensive datasets. This enables the study of meteorological driving forces, validation of hydrological models, and detailed analysis of snow cover and frozen ground processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，配备自动气象站和超级站用于雪和冻土观测，能够收集全面的数据集。这使得研究气象驱动因素、验证水文模型以及对雪盖和冻土过程进行详细分析成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in maintaining high-quality data collection in alpine regions, and how have recent methodologies sought to overcome these barriers?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高山地区维持高质量数据收集的主要挑战是什么？最近的方法论是如何寻求克服这些障碍的？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit consistent data collection. Recent methodologies have sought to overcome these barriers by developing next-generation ecosystem observation networks and establishing automatic meteorological stations and superstations, which provide spatially distributed meteorological variables and datasets for remote sensing validation and hydrologic model improvement.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集。最近的方法论试图克服这些障碍，通过开发下一代生态系统观测网络和建立自动气象站及超级气象站，提供空间分布的气象变量和数据集，以便进行遥感验证和水文模型改进。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting consistent and complete datasets in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集一致和完整的数据集可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行完整和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network could improve the understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 预计一个集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络能够改善对高山地区水文过程的理解，原因如下：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Such a network is expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and allow the evaluation of distributed models, ultimately improving a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 这样的网络预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型，最终提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be a scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, and how does this impact research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区可能会缺乏观测数据，这对研究有什么影响？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data is due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, which has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research, yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也激励了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in developing accurate datasets for understanding snow cover and frozen ground phenomena in alpine hydrology?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在开发准确的数据集以理解高山水文学中的雪盖和冻土现象时，主要面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data due to access difficulties and technological barriers hinders research. Additionally, challenges include the influence of strong winds affecting snow density data collection, and the need for high-quality snow and frozen ground data to parameterize models. Overcoming these challenges requires innovative observation networks and data assimilation techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺阻碍了研究。此外，强风对雪密度数据收集的影响，以及需要高质量的雪和冻土数据来参数化模型，都是面临的挑战。克服这些挑战需要创新的观测网络和数据同化技术。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might current datasets be enhanced to better support predictive modeling of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前数据集如何增强以更好地支持阿尔卑斯地区水文过程的预测建模？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Enhancement of current datasets could involve expanding the observation network, integrating remote sensing data, and improving data quality through advanced processing techniques. Addressing uncertainties and validating remote sensing products with fine-resolution data could also improve predictive modeling. Such enhancements aim to provide comprehensive data for understanding and simulating alpine hydrological processes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前数据集的增强可以包括扩展观测网络、整合遥感数据以及通过先进的处理技术提高数据质量。解决不确定性并用高分辨率数据验证遥感产品也可以改善预测建模。这些增强旨在提供全面的数据，以理解和模拟高山水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why there is a scarcity of observation data in the alpine region despite the presence of advanced observational networks.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么尽管有先进的观测网络，阿尔卑斯地区仍然缺乏观测数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is mainly due to difficulties of access, technological barriers, and the cold, harsh climate with complex topography, which inhibits complete and consistent data collection.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据稀缺的主要原因是获取困难、技术障碍以及寒冷、恶劣的气候和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了全面和一致的数据收集。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure how snow density can be accurately estimated when snow density data are not available.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在没有雪密度数据的情况下，如何准确估计雪密度。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Snow density can be estimated using snow depth and snow water equivalent (SWE) data, even though direct snow density data might not be available due to the influence of strong winds and other challenges.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 雪密度可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据进行估算，尽管由于强风和其他挑战，直接的雪密度数据可能无法获得。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the freeze-thaw processes are captured in such harsh and complex alpine environments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在如此严酷和复杂的高山环境中，如何捕捉到冻融过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Freeze-thaw processes are captured using high-resolution soil physics datasets obtained from specialized superstations, which include measurements of soil temperature and moisture at multiple layers, as well as thermal and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 冻融过程通过从专门的超级站获取的高分辨率土壤物理数据集进行捕捉，这些数据集包括多个层次的土壤温度和湿度测量，以及表层土壤的热导率和水力导率。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the techniques used for snow cover and frozen ground observation and evaluate how these techniques contribute to the understanding of hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于雪盖和冻土观测的技术，并评估这些技术如何有助于理解水文过程。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Snow cover properties are collected using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments at a snow observation superstation. High-resolution soil physics datasets capture freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. These observations help to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological models and validate remote sensing products, improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 雪覆盖特性通过先进的技术和仪器在雪观测超级站收集。高分辨率土壤物理数据集捕捉了来自冻土观测超级站的冻融过程。这些观测有助于为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，并验证遥感产品，从而提高对高山水文过程的预测理解。
